Maus is a graphic novel by American cartoonist Art Spiegelman, serialized from 
1980 to 1991. It depicts Spiegelman interviewing his father about his experiences 
as a Polish Jew and Holocaust survivor. The work employs postmodern 
techniques and represents Jews as mice and other Germans and Poles as cats 
and pigs .... Art talks about the book with his psychiatrist Paul Pavel, a Czech 
Holocaust...
